content: This evening Colbert had John McCains daughter on speaking on behalf of her new role within the Republican party as she signed up when she supported her father running for President. That I guess was the ultimate bonding moment for father and daughter. She is only 24 and said that she is pro life, pro sex and pro gay marraige. I have to say, Colbert was pretty tame with her and she was a little flush at times but did manage to stay on topic and get her point across. She was well thought out, not bitter, had ideas for the party going forward and enjoyed her sense of humor. Her response to pro sex is just that she does not think that is going to work for the old party. She took on that term prosex to oppose Bristol Palins stand on sex and abortion. McCains daughter thinks they should talk about the reality of sex at any age and the consquences of those actions. She wants it talked about in shcool, church, family home etc she feels you must have safe sex and more optioins like adoption if the condom is faulty. she said that no twittering, blogging etc was going to make anyone think the party has changed and are hip but she said the gop is a great party and there is a place for gay people within the party, and ways to work together to support education on sexual issues she thinks there are some really good old boys from the party but it is time for the next generation to step in and make a case for change. She would not talk about Palin or call anyone out. She just was sweet spoken with a message she wanted to get across. I think I am going to keep a watch on her. She seems to be coming off very well so I put her as one to watch. I think Obama has this for two terms and unless Michelle runs it will then go back to the right if they are ready to run with someone. We tackled the racial issue, now lets cross the female issue. It is time. It is time to start looking at a young Condi Rice, only she wont run..why?... but we need someone just like her. smart, well spoken, highly educated, was in the inner group,knows the players and looks the part. they are already trying to build up the GOP with the governors. They need to change this next election around to get the new breed of smart, fun, good looking people in there of the next generation. they need to spend the time in office doing great things for their states and wait for the opportunity to take the house back and a few governors could slip into senate seats What do you think,,is it possible to get a fresh intellegent female ready to run for President? Who is the list? Not Hillary, she will be too old. It would have Gop still has some female people to look at that might shine. I would love to hear your thoughts on this.

title: Who watched Colbert this evening?

content: This evening Colbert had John McCains daughter on speaking on behalf of her new role within the Republican party as she signed up when she supported her father running for President. That I guess was the ultimate bonding moment for father and daughter. She is only 24 and said that she is pro life, pro sex and pro gay marraige. I have to say, Colbert was pretty tame with her and she was a little flush at times but did manage to stay on topic and get her point across. She was well thought out, not bitter, had ideas for the party going forward and enjoyed her sense of humor. Her response to pro sex is just that she does not think that is going to work for the old party. She took on that term prosex to oppose Bristol Palins stand on sex and abortion. McCains daughter thinks they should talk about the reality of sex at any age and the consquences of those actions. She wants it talked about in shcool, church, family home etc she feels you must have safe sex and more optioins like adoption if the condom is faulty. she said that no twittering, blogging etc was going to make anyone think the party has changed and are hip but she said the gop is a great party and there is a place for gay people within the party, and ways to work together to support education on sexual issues she thinks there are some really good old boys from the party but it is time for the next generation to step in and make a case for change. She would not talk about Palin or call anyone out. She just was sweet spoken with a message she wanted to get across. I think I am going to keep a watch on her. She seems to be coming off very well so I put her as one to watch. I think Obama has this for two terms and unless Michelle runs it will then go back to the right if they are ready to run with someone. We tackled the racial issue, now lets cross the female issue. It is time. It is time to start looking at a young Condi Rice, only she wont run..why?... but we need someone just like her. smart, well spoken, highly educated, was in the inner group,knows the players and looks the part. they are already trying to build up the GOP with the governors. They need to change this next election around to get the new breed of smart, fun, good looking people in there of the next generation. they need to spend the time in office doing great things for their states and wait for the opportunity to take the house back and a few governors could slip into senate seats What do you think,,is it possible to get a fresh intellegent female ready to run for President? Who is the list? Not Hillary, she will be too old. It would have Gop still has some female people to look at that might shine. I would love to hear your thoughts on this.

title: Who watched Colbert this evening?

content: This evening Colbert had John McCains daughter on speaking on behalf of her new role within the Republican party as she signed up when she supported her father running for President. That I guess was the ultimate bonding moment for father and daughter. She is only 24 and said that she is pro life, pro sex and pro gay marraige. I have to say, Colbert was pretty tame with her and she was a little flush at times but did manage to stay on topic and get her point across. She was well thought out, not bitter, had ideas for the party going forward and enjoyed her sense of humor. Her response to pro sex is just that she does not think that is going to work for the old party. She took on that term prosex to oppose Bristol Palins stand on sex and abortion. McCains daughter thinks they should talk about the reality of sex at any age and the consquences of those actions. She wants it talked about in shcool, church, family home etc she feels you must have safe sex and more optioins like adoption if the condom is faulty. she said that no twittering, blogging etc was going to make anyone think the party has changed and are hip but she said the gop is a great party and there is a place for gay people within the party, and ways to work together to support education on sexual issues she thinks there are some really good old boys from the party but it is time for the next generation to step in and make a case for change. She would not talk about Palin or call anyone out. She just was sweet spoken with a message she wanted to get across. I think I am going to keep a watch on her. She seems to be coming off very well so I put her as one to watch. I think Obama has this for two terms and unless Michelle runs it will then go back to the right if they are ready to run with someone. We tackled the racial issue, now lets cross the female issue. It is time. It is time to start looking at a young Condi Rice, only she wont run..why?... but we need someone just like her. smart, well spoken, highly educated, was in the inner group,knows the players and looks the part. they are already trying to build up the GOP with the governors. They need to change this next election around to get the new breed of smart, fun, good looking people in there of the next generation. they need to spend the time in office doing great things for their states and wait for the opportunity to take the house back and a few governors could slip into senate seats What do you think,,is it possible to get a fresh intellegent female ready to run for President? Who is the list? Not Hillary, she will be too old. It would have Gop still has some female people to look at that might shine. I would love to hear your thoughts on this.
